FontFaceSet.summary: The FontFaceSet interface of the CSS Font Loading API manages the loading of font-faces and querying of their download status.

remarks.para: A FontFaceSet instance is a Set-like object that can hold an ordered set of objects.
This property is available as , or self.fonts in web workers.

FontFaceSetLoading.summary: The loading event fires when the document begins loading fonts.

FontFaceSetStatus.summary: The status read-only property of the interface returns the loading state of the fonts in the set.

FontFaceSetEntries.summary: The entries() method of the interface returns a new {{jsxref("Iterator")}} object, containing an array of [value,value] for each element in the FontFaceSet.
FontFaceSetEntries.returns: A new iterator object that contains an array of [value, value] for each element in the CustomStateSet, in insertion order.

FontFaceSetHas.summary: The has() method of the interface returns a {{jsxref("Boolean")}} asserting whether an element is present with the given value.
FontFaceSetHas.returns: A , true if value exists in the FontFaceSet.

FontFaceSetAdd.summary: The add() method of the interface adds a new font to the set.

FontFaceSetForEach.summary: The forEach() method of the interface executes a provided function for each value in the FontFaceSet object.

FontFaceSetClear.summary: The clear() method of the interface removes all fonts added via this interface. Fonts added with the {{cssxref("@font-face")}} rule are not removed.

FontFaceSetSize.summary: The size property of the interface returns the number of items in the FontFaceSet.
FontFaceSetSize.value: An integer indicating the number of items in the FontFaceSet.

FontFaceSetLoadingerror.summary: The loadingerror event fires when fonts have finished loading, but some or all fonts have failed to load.

FontFaceSetLoad.summary: The load() method of the forces all the fonts given in parameters to be loaded.
FontFaceSetLoad.returns:
A {{jsxref("Promise")}} fulfilled with an {{jsxref("Array")}} of loaded objects. The
promise is fulfilled when all the fonts are loaded; it is rejected if one of the fonts
failed to load.

FontFaceSetDelete.summary: The delete() method of the interface removes a font from the set.

remarks.para: Font faces that were added to the set using the CSS @font-face rule remain connected to the corresponding CSS, and cannot be deleted.

FontFaceSetDelete.returns: A boolean value which is true if the deletion was successful, and false otherwise.

FontFaceSetLoadingdone.summary: The loadingdone event fires when the document has loaded all fonts.

FontFaceSetCheck.summary: The check() method of the returns true if you can render some text using the given font specification without attempting to use any fonts in this FontFaceSet that are not yet fully loaded. This means you can use the font specification without causing a font swap.

blockquote.para: The check() method is not designed to verify whether a specific font style can be rendered or if a particular font is fully loaded. Instead, it returns true if the specified text can be rendered using the given font specification without causing a font swap. This means that even if the requested font isn't available or fully loaded, the method may still return true. This behavior helps avoid the visual issues associated with font swapping but may be counterintuitive if you're trying to confirm the availability of a specific font.

FontFaceSetCheck.returns: A value that is true if rendering text with the given font specification will not attempt to use any fonts in this FontFaceSet that are not yet fully loaded.This means that all fonts in this FontFaceSet that are matched by the given font specification have a status property set to "loaded".Otherwise, this function returns false.

FontFaceSetKeys.summary: The keys() method of the interface is an alias for .
FontFaceSetKeys.returns: A new iterator object containing the values for each element in the given FontFaceSet, in insertion order.

FontFaceSetValues.summary: The values() method of the interface returns a new iterator object that yields the values for each element in the FontFaceSet object in insertion order.
FontFaceSetValues.returns: A new iterator object containing the values for each element in the given FontFaceSet, in insertion order.

FontFaceSetReady.summary: The ready read-only property of the interface returns a {{jsxref("Promise")}} that resolves to the given .

remarks.para: The promise will only resolve once the document has completed loading fonts, layout operations are completed, and no further font loads are needed.

FontFaceSetReady.value: A {{jsxref("Promise")}} that resolves to the given .
